head.supplied: Memorandum in reply to the Undersecretary's minute of 4/6/83. ¶ ¶ The present account of £35.6/6d ¶ closes ¶ the expenditure of part I. of the "Census"; the second part cannot appear before 1884. ¶...

div.p: Z83/5940, unit 1409, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

The file includes a note written by Luehmann and signed by M that probably constitutes the starting point of the exchange: 'Submitted for the favorable consideration of the Honorable the Chief Secretary. Melbourne, 22/5/83'. This is followed by a file note signed by Wilson, marked 'C.S.O' and dated '/6/83': 'Will the Government Botanist be good enough to inform me whether the accompanying account represents the total cost of printing the "Index of Plants indigenous to Australia" & if not what the total is.' Memorandum in reply to the Undersecretary's minute of 4/6/83.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
The printing of the "Census" of Australian plants
B82.13.16. cost

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
247.12/6
MS annotation in a clerk's hand: 'Will the Government Botanist be good enough to inform me whether the sum of £247.12s.6d represents the whole expenditure for printing, binding &c, including the 2nd part. C.S.O. /6/83.' Before signing this, Wilson added 'or if not what the total cost is likely to be?'
To this M replied on 14 June 1883: 'The sum of £247.12/6d represents the total expenditure of part 1 of the Census, as issued already. The second part will not be quite so large, nor will it appear during the next finance-year, and should it never be printed, the first one will remain complete in itself.'

div.p: The present account of £35.6/6d closes the expenditure of part I. of the "Census"; the second part cannot appear before 1884.
